intro: Rosa × jurana, commonly known as the hybrid tea rose, is a popular ornamental plant characterized by its fragrant, single or double blooms. It is a cross between Rosa damascena and Rosa gallica, resulting in a variety that exhibits a wide range of colors and flower forms. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with thorny stems and dark green, glossy foliage. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, requiring regular pruning to maintain its shape and promote healthy growth. Rosa × jurana is widely cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens and floral arrangements.
